channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: I write again to request that the double yellow lines at the junction of Charlton Park Drive and Old Bath Road in Cheltenham be cleaned and repainted., 19th September
item.description:
The junction of Charlton Park Drive and Old Bath Rd Cheltenham GL53 7??Cars are regularly parking there causing problems for drivers leaving CPD forcing them onto the wrong side of the road; dangerous when traffic is entering CP D That part of the road has not been cleaned for sometime.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: TMC - Defects - Road Markings problem, 19th September
item.description:
3 month ticket with road closure please refresh junction road markings Centre lines x6, double dash x20,Single dash x15, give way triangle x1 (Faded Road Markings)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -CW6 Potholes problem, 19th September
item.description:
15DB 28day with give and take plus 15 min delay boards carriageway pothole 500x400x40mm tarmac patch required (CW6 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Kerbs and Channels problem, 19th September
item.description:
28 day with 3 way traffic lights plus temporary footway closure please lift and replace x1 broken kerb 900x150x20mm stats required. No parking cones required prior to works. Number 1 (CW Edge Kerbing & Channels)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 19th September
item.description:
28day with give and take plus temporary footway closure footway abrupt level difference 1800x300x20mm tarmac patch required stats required (FW6 Abrupt Level Differences)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole sunk causing severe thud as driving., 19th September
item.description:
Drain and cover sunken causing severe thud driving over. Easily cause damage to vehicles. On the bend as you head into Stoke orchard. Repeat work required. This has been repaired before. Clearly faulty workmanship.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Stoke Orchard, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A severe dip in road tarmac, evasive action needed, but cant do that with oncoming traffic., 19th September
item.description:
On side of carriageway after Berry's bunnies heading back toward stoke orchard. The severe dip in the road causes a huge thud on tyres when going over it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipping andFlooding., 19th September
item.description:
Elmbridge Court ,A417 / A40 ,subways in poor state of repairs broken drain covers ,dirty walls ,graffiti over grown trees and weeds, and this is part of the Flagship £48 million cycle route between Gloucester and Cheltenham , over 50,0000 cyclists, pedestrians Mobility scooters users will travel these subways needs sorting ASAP ,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain blocked with mud, 19th September
item.description:
Drain blocked with mud This area regularly floods in the winter Can this drain please be cleared before we see more flooding?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain blocked with mud, 19th September
item.description:
Drain blocked with mud which has now filled the drain This area regularly floods in the winter Can this drain please be cleared before we see more flooding?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Gretton Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
